author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sanitary workers, working in the extended wards of 61 to 65, seeking the intervention of the Mayor in Tiruchi on Thursday.— Photo: A.Muralitharan

A group of sanitary workers who are working in the extended wards of 61 to 65 thronged the Corporation office on Thursday.

The five wards were to be added to the city following the merger of the Tiruverumbur town panchayat, Pappakurichi, Ellakudi, Keezha Kalkandarkottai and Alathur village panchayats, all located in the eastern periphery of the city, with the Tiruchi Corporation a few years back.

The workers employed in the erstwhile Tiruverumbur town panchayat and other local bodies said they were working for paltry wages and urged the Corporation to regularise their services.

They complained that despite repeated representations their case has not been considered sympathetically. Some of them, including women in tears, urged the City Engineer and the Mayor A.Jaya to take steps to get the services regularised. The Mayor assured to look into their grievance.
title: Regularise our service, say sanitary workers
